abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment (EA) of
            the Natural Resource Management and Poverty Reduction
            Project aims to identify issues within the main project
            activities which may lead to negative environmental and
            social impacts, or instances where identified positive
            impacts could be enhanced. This report discusses some of the
            impacts: 1) environmental impacts of construction can be
            mitigated by requiring all sub-contractors be subject to
            contractual clauses to manage the environmental impacts. 2)
            Increased pressure on grazing can be mitigated by developing
            grazing management plans for each watershed. 3)
            Environmental impacts of fertilizer use can be mitigated by
            ensuring that the correct dosage is known. 4) Environmental
            impacts of irrigation can be mitigated by providing
            appropriate training which covers use minimization through
            precise application, waterlogging and salinization, erosion,
            eutrophication, and water pollution. 5) Negative impacts on
            water resources, e.g., increased pollution and sediment can
            be reduced by developing water resource management plans. A
            water balance should be calculated for each micro catchment,
            and a water quality survey should be carried out to provide
            a baseline for subsequent monitoring. 6) To develop
            sustainable provision of wood and tree products, all trees
            planted sustainable harvesting rates should be calculated
            and observed.
